publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1269 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti-That the Parliament congratulates Nicola Benedetti of West Kilbride in Ayrshire on her well-deserved achievement of becoming the BBC Young Musician of the Year; regards a good musical education as a fundamental right for all Scottish schoolchildren, and urges the Scottish Executive to ensure that sufficient funds are made available for all children in state schools who wish to learn to play a musical instrument free of charge.
S2M-1269 Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti (lodged on 5 May 2004) Frances Curran*, Colin Fox*, John Swinburne*, Donald Gorrie*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-1269 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti-That the Parliament congratulates Nicola Benedetti of West Kilbride in Ayrshire on her well-deserved achievement of becoming the BBC Young Musician of the Year; regards a good musical education as a fundamental right for all Scottish schoolchildren, and urges the Scottish Executive to ensure that sufficient funds are made available for all children in state schools who wish to learn to play a musical instrument free of charge. Supported by: Frances Curran, Colin Fox, John Swinburne, Donald Gorrie, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Adam Ingram*, Linda Fabiani*, Campbell Martin*, Chris Ballance*, Robin Harper*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-1269 Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti (lodged on 5 May 2004) Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-1269 Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti (lodged on 5 May 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1269 Congratulations to Nicola Benedetti (lodged on 5 May 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
